d: C Programming is the foundation of modern software development. This 3-month industry-oriented course is designed to help students master core programming concepts, logic building, and real-worldproblem solving using the C language. Perfect for students aiming for careers in software development,embedded systems, cybersecurity, and competitive programming.
cur: History & features of C, Structure of a C program, Compilation process, Keywords, identifiers,variables, and First C programs.
Data types & type modifiers, Constants & type casting, Operators & expressions, and Operator precedence.
printf() /scanf(), Escape sequences, Conditionalstatements(if,switch), and Loops(for, while, do-while).
Function declaration & calling, Call by value, Recursion, and Scope & lifetime of variables.
1D & 2D arrays,Array operations, and Passing arraysto functions.
String declaration & handling, String functions, andArray ofstrings.
Pointer basics, Pointers with arrays & functions, Pointer arithmetic, and Dynamic memory allocation.
Structures & unions,Array ofstructures, Nested structures, and typedef.
File modes, File operations, Reading & writing files, and Command line arguments.
Macros, Conditional compilation, Storage classes, and Enumerations Practice
Types of errors, Debugging techniques, Code optimization, and Memory management best practices.

t: C++ Programming from Beginner to Advanced
d: C++ is a powerful, high-performance programming language widely used in software development, game development, system programming, and competitive coding. This industry-focused C++ course is designed to take learners from zero programming knowledge to building real-world applications, while developing strong logic, problem-solving, and object-oriented programming skills.
hl: C++ programming from fundamentals to advanced concepts
STL for fast and efficient coding
cur: History & features of C++, C vs C++, Structure of a C++ program, Compilation process, Keywords, identifiers & tokens, and Basic programs.
Data types & variables, Constants & type modifiers, Operators & precedence, and cin, cout & manipulators.
Conditional statements (if, switch), Looping statements (for, while, do-while), and Jump statements.
Function declaration & definition, Call by value & reference, Inline functions, Default arguments, Function overloading, and Recursion.
1D & 2D arrays, Character arrays & string class, Pointer basics, and Pointers with arrays & functions.
new & delete, Dynamic arrays, and Memory management best practices.
Classes & objects, Constructors & destructors, Access specifiers, this pointer, and Static members.
Types of inheritance, Function overriding, Virtual functions, and Runtime polymorphism.
Abstract classes, Pure virtual functions, and Function & class templates.
Containers (vector, list, map, set), Iterators, and Algorithms.
try, catch, throw, User-defined exceptions, File streams, and Text & binary file operations.
